fields.description: Since we are currently not shipping the source code for the Office Connector, we need to tell our customers about this on our relevant pages (e.g. on http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Building+Confluence+From+Source+Code, but probably there are a few more pages).
fields.summary: Clarify source code shipped with product

fields.description:
When German is set as the default language:

* Both _Log In_ and _Sign Up_ are translated to _Anmelden_
* That's definitely wrong
* In Confluence 2.7.3, _Sign Up_ is translated to _Registrieren_ and _Anmelden_ for _Log In_ which is correct

Please see [screenshot|^german_translation.jpg]
fields.summary: Incorrect German Translation for "Sign Up"

fields.description: contetxtPath should not be used in the drop-down, instead the url should be entirely constructed on the server side. If possible could we please have this for the next major release of Confluence?
fields.summary: Remove contextPath from drop-down.js

fields.description:
The following email was recieved from a customer after it was mentioned to him that we do not oficially support Confluence when run on SPARC:

{quote}
I have to say that I was not aware about the SPARC exclusion, something that will prove an issue here since we have no Intel based hardware.  The documentation is not really clear - for example, here, it is not mentioned, and here it is rather ambiguous (I initially read the line as Mac OSX on x86 only, not all of the preceding OS on x86 only).
{quote}

First link to documentation is:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Server+Hardware+Requirements+Guide

Second link is:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/System+Requirements

fields.description:
If response compression is on, Confluence will send a Content-Encoding header without a value. Doing so is against spec and breaks in some clients, most notably some JavaScript XML-RPC libraries.

JIRA had the same issue recently as JRA-15658.

The fix should simply be to upgrade Confluence's version of atlassian-gzipfilter from 1.6 to the latest.
fields.summary: Upgrade to latest atlassian-gzipfilter to fix remote APIs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14019].
  {panel}

This issue is a follow up on the comment raised at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Remote+API+Specification#comment-168004177.

We're using Confluence as a documentation authoring environment.
As such, we periodically download content from Confluence for translation into various languages. [this content is then passed into a translation management system].

Not all versions of a page are fit to be translated, so we routinely have authors save a version with the comment  "Ready for translation". 
Then, the author might continue to edit the page. 

However, right now, with the remote api, we can neither read version comments, nor download anything other than the current version of the page.

What we need to be able to do through the API is:
1. Loop through all versions a particular page, and find the most recent version that has a particular comment, like, say - "ready for translation".

2. I then want to pull down that version's content.

For it to work, I think I need:

- the 'save comment' to be part of the PageHistorySummary object

Both of these features are available in MediaWiki's API - and that allows for a more dynamic documentation authoring environment.

Appreciate anything you can do on this.
fields.summary: Make a page's various revisions and their associated save-comments readable through the API.

fields.description:
1. Create new page. In Wiki Markup  mode input text, e.g.:
{quote}
One

Two
{quote}

*Note: there is space between first and second lines.*
2.	Save this page.
3.	Open this page in  Rich Text mode and  write some text into space between lines. E.g.: 
{quote}
One
Some text
Two
{quote}
4.	Save and look at page now. The latter change was lost!
fields.summary: Rich Text mode doesn't save changes between linebreaks in IE

fields.description:
When one define column width in pixel, switching to RTE then to Wikimarkup editor will update the width automatically. 

This can be observed according to this sequence:
# edit page using wiki markup editor and define column width with unit value of px (eg. 185px)
# without saving the page, switch to rich text
# without saving, switch back to wiki mark up editor and you will see the 'px' sign removed
# without saving, switch back to rich text then to wiki mark up and you will see the column width changed to 100%

This problem cannot be replicated when I used % (eg. 20%) as a unit value.
fields.summary: Switching between rich text editor and wiki markup corrupts column macro's width

fields.description:
In 2.9.2, when clicking on a link to an attachment in an HTML export, the appropiate reader/application is launched based on the filetype. In 2.10 this is not working because the attachments do not have a filetype due to the current naming convention of all numbers with no extension. This is causing browsers to complain and is annoying for end users. Instead of the appropiate application/reader opening the attachment, firefox opens a prompt: "You have chosen to open 6127634 which is a: application/octet-stream .... What should Firefox do with this file?" A similar prompt is displayed in IE. Attachment link's html source from a 2.9.2 HTML export: {code}
Word2007userguide.docx (application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document) {code} Attachment link's html source from a 2.10 HTML export: {code}
Word2007userguide.docx (application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document) {code} It works perfectly fine for jpegs, gifs, but seems to fail on anything else that doesn't open up in web browser normally.
fields.summary: HTML export: Attachments are missing filetypes/extensions

fields.description:
According to the [office connector docs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Office+Connector], of the plugin modules that could be enabled:

!officeconn_defaultconfig.png!

The following only apply to versions of Confluence before 2.10, and don't do anything:

- Edit in Word UI on page actions
- Edit in Word UI on page tabs 
- Import Word UI on page tabs 

Additionally there is the [Office Connector Configuration|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Office+Connector#ConfiguringtheOfficeConnector-config]:

!officeconn_config.png!

A _very_ careful reading of the docs is required to discover that actually, that first "Edit in Word button location" _does nothing_ because it is dependent on the obsolete module.  Sadly due to CONF-13994 this is likely to be the first thing users fiddle with.

If half the configuration options for a plugin are no longer functional in 2.10, wouldn't it be better to *get rid of them*, rather than leaving them around to confuse users?
fields.summary: Office connector contains obsolete and non-functional options

fields.description:
The Office Connector plugin is bundled with Confluence 2.10.  However there is no "Edit in Word" link in the Tools menu or anywhere else, because the relevant plugin module is not enabled:

!officeconn_defaultconfig.png!

Is there some reason we're not enabling it by default?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13993].
  {panel}

I've created this issue against Confluence, because it's the main application I'm concerned with here, though this is an issue with JIRA as well as your other applications.

We have a Crowd+JIRA+Confluence+Crucible+Fisheye installation. The major thing thats come back every time from feedback has been that there should be a way to navigate quickly between each of the applications.

I've attempted to do this using the Custom HTML feature in Confluence and by editing the templates in JIRA, with some limited success. I've not been able to get the tabs looking the same on both applications because of the limitations of the CSS and HTML that is there. Attached is examples with the current results. HTML + CSS can be supplied.

So here is my suggestion:

Confluence (and all other Atlassian applications) should have a switch that lets you enable a 'Top Navigation Bar' which enables a bar similar to the one I've shown here, that lets you add a customisable list of links. The style should be the same across all applications and behave consistently, with a configurable highlight to show the currently selected application.
fields.summary: Navigation integration to other Applications

There is an issue with the way that the Incoming links and Outgoing links lists are populated for each page, currently it is picking up all links which uses the standard \[alias|link] and \[link] syntaxes, however, it does not pick up those that uses \[alias|link|tooltip].

To replicate, simply add a link to a specific page to any other page which uses the \[alias|link|tooltip] format, then view the Outgoing links list for the current page, it will not get picked up, if you try it without the tooltip, it is picked up normally.

Regards,
Bo Wang

fields.description:
I was working on upgrading my Confluence development server from version 2.9.2 to 2.10 when I ran into the following problem.

My Confluence 2.9.2 instance (and 2.8 before that) ran over regular http and over https without any trouble.  However, after installing 2.10, I was no longer able to connect to Confluence via https.  After examining the catalina.out file, I saw that the listener and connector as specified in my server.xml file had opened the proper ports:

Dec 5, 2008 2:41:30 PM org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol init
INFO: Initializing Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-8090
Dec 5, 2008 2:41:30 PM org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol init
INFO: Initializing Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-8453

However, when I would try to connect to Confluence via https on port 8453, the browser would show evidence that it had connected and was waiting for a response.  It would eventually timeout.  I attempted to debug this using using the following openssl command:

openssl s_client -connect confluencedev:8453

This command would respond with a "CONNECT" message, and then after some time it would timeout with an SSL Handshake error.

I did not change the locations of any keystores, and the configuration matched my Confluence 2.9.2 configuration.

Looking through the Tomcat 6 documentation, I noticed that there is a parameter that has been added since Tomcat 5.5, SSLEnabled.  This parameter by default is set to "false."  The https connector section in the server.xml file was missing the "SSLEnabled" parameter.  In order to make SSL work, that parameter needs to be included and set to "true."  I changed my connector to this:

<Connector port="8453" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
                   maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" maxSpareThreads="75"
                   enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
                   acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true" SSLEnabled="true"
                   clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS"
                   URIEncoding="UTF-8" keystorePass="blah" />

After making that change, Confluence 2.10 now works over https on port 8453.  It would be great if this change could be included in the Confluence documentation or if the SSLEnabled parameter could be included in the https connector in the default server.xml file

-Nick
fields.summary: Confluence 2.10 Standalone Default SSL Implementation Not Compatible With Tomcat 6

fields.description:
When trying to upgrade from Confluence 2.7.2 to 2.10 we experienced bugs rendering the Spaces macro and the Recently Updated Items macro.  We managed to resolve the issue by altering the upgrade procedure slightly.  Pointing the new 2.10 WAR at the existing database *did not* update the schema.  Instead we had to install into a fresh schema, allow Confluence to create the tables fresh, then imported the 2.7.2 data into the new schema.

This process was not evident from the documentation, or if we missed something in the process of pointing the new WAR at the old schema, that was not evident either.  Please consider clarifying the appropriate procedure in the documentation.

The support ticket can be found here: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-26629
fields.summary: Upgrade Instructions Unclear About Schema Changes

  {panel}

I think it would be great to have a navigation bar on all Atlassian products that link to all other Atlassian products a company is using.

The reason for this is to assist with navigating between products for new users, and to give the products a single level of consistancy.

For this to work all products would require an administration screen where a standard header could be set which would contain the links from the current product to all the other products (that are configured)

Example:
If Company A is using Confluence, JIRA, Crowd, and Bamboo, they could easily access any of the other products in the suite from any other product in the suite. So if a user was in Confluence, they would be able to click on a single link in the header/tool bar/ navigation bar for Crowd, JIRA, or Bamboo and would get taken there straight away.

On the "Manage Group" section of the Confluence Administration page, the navigation bar at the bottom always starts showing pages 1-4 as follows:

 [1] [2] [3] [4] [Next]  (see attachment)

This happens regardless of how many pages of groups there actually are.  This becomes very confusing when there are more than 4 pages of groups.  You need to click [Next] when viewing page 4 in order to navigate to the next 4 pages of information.  The navigation bar should reflect that there are more pages.

[Prev] [1] . . . [5] [6] [7] [8] [9] . . . [38] [Next]

fields.description:
One of our users is trying to move a page (reparent a page) in edit mode.  Normally, when you click to edit a page, and you edit the Location area, the current page is highlighted, and "you can move the highlighted page by dragging it to a new position in the tree" (as the instruction says).  This is illustrated in the attached *confluence_page_edit_normal.jpg*.  For most pages in our system, this works normally.

However, it is puzzling to us that some pages don't let us do this.  When we click to edit the page, the Location area is shown in collapsed mode (see *confluence_page_edit_broken1.jpg*).  When we expand the tree, the current page is not selected, and when you try clicking and dragging it to a new position, it gives you a little "circle with a line through it" image, and prevents you from moving the page.  This is shown in the attached *confluence_page_edit_broken2.jpg*.

We tried different browsers (Firefox 3.0 and IE7), same thing happens.

We tried with both regular users and administrators, same thing happens.

There are no restrictions on the page (or in the space for that matter).  The page has children, but that hasn't stopped us from moving pages in the past.  None of the child pages have restrictions.

This seems like a bug, perhaps due to the content in the page.  There is little in the page that I can see, however, that might be causing the problem.  It is standard out-of-the-box confluence markup.  There are no special plug-ins used on the page. 

I tried searchi JIRA for a similar issue... couldn't find one.  So I'm raising this bug.

It's not a blocker for us.  We can move the page using the Pages "tree" view in the Space area.
fields.summary: Cannot move pages

fields.description:
Adding white space in *atlassian-plugin.xml* cause Confluence to throw exceptions saying that it cannot find the velocity templates. 

For example, the xml was changed from
{code}
<result name="input" type="velocity">/templates/extra/myplugin/add-item.vm</result>
{code}

to

{code}
<result name="input" type="velocity">
/templates/extra/myplugin/add-item.vm
</result>
{code}

after formatting. It would appear that you should remove trailing and leading blanks/tabs from the value before using it to retrieve the velocity pages.

Here's the first part of the exception (note the extra white space):
{noformat}
org.apache.velocity.exception.ResourceNotFoundException: Unable to find resource '/agilent/labs/
/templates/extra/myplugin/add-item.vm
'
at com.atlassian.confluence.util.velocity.ConfigurableResourceManager.loadResource(ConfigurableResourceManager.java:400)
at com.atlassian.confluence.util.velocity.ConfigurableResourceManager.getResource(ConfigurableResourceManager.java:304)
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.RuntimeInstance.getTemplate(RuntimeInstance.java:1102)
at org.apache.velocity.runtime.RuntimeInstance.getTemplate(RuntimeInstance.java:1077)
at org.apache.velocity.app.VelocityEngine.getTemplate(VelocityEngine.java:528)
{noformat}

This is because we do not ignore [white spaces|http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/javax/xml/parsers/DocumentBuilderFactory.html#setIgnoringElementContentWhitespace(boolean)] when parsing XML documents.
fields.summary: White spaces in XML documents are not ignored causing ResourceNotFoundException

fields.description:
When Confluence is running behind Apache through mod_proxy, resources (such as the {{ui.css}} file) are not loaded correctly as it does not use the Base Server URL but instead the local URL (between Apache and Confluence).

Here are some example settings:
{code:none}
<Proxy *>
Order deny,allow
Allow from all
</Proxy>

ProxyPass / http://localhost:8080/
ProxyPassReverse / http://localhost:8080/
{code}

The current workaround for Apache 2.x is using the following setting:
{code:none}
ProxyPreserveHost On
{code}

This issue is not present in previous versions of Confluence
fields.summary: Rich Text editor does not display when Confluence is running behind Apache

fields.description:
During initial setup of Confluence and hooking into an external database via JDBC, if you use a user that doesn't have sufficient privileges to perform operations on the tables in the database, you will get a generic error page.  If you then change the username and now the user has all privileges on the database, you will get the same error.  The logs will report that the same user, the first user, is still not able to create the tables in the database.  It seems that what's happening is that the information of the first  user with insufficient privileges gets hardcoded into the confluence.cfg.xml file even though the process errors and fails. This is what I did:

-I gave my test user just a random privilege, show_view, and nothing else.
-setup wizard > jdbc connection > put in test user credentials
-Confluence spits out an error
-Created a real user, with all the correct privileges
-setup wizard > jdbc connection > put in the real user credentials
-Confluence spits out the same error. Logs report that the first test user is still being used to authenticate and is still failing.

The current solution is to delete the confluence-home directory and start over.
fields.summary: Confluence.cfg.xml file written prematurely
